main_name: Digitalis × valinii Foxlight Ruby Glow ('Takforugl'PBR) (Foxlight Series)

botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts are toxic if ingested. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Digitalis can be biennials or usually short-lived perennials forming a rosette of simple leaves with bell-shaped flowers in slender, erect, usually one-sided racemes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Will grow in almost any soil or situation except very wet or very dry; ideally a sheltered, warm site with humus-rich soil, with at least 6 hours of sun in summer. May be short-lived for a perennial. See foxglove cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division in early spring. As this plant is protected by Plant Breeders' Rights, any propagation should be for personal rather than commercial use
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead to encourage more flowers (unless seeds are required)
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, leaf and bud eelworms, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, downy mildews and leaf spot
